description: This course explores British literature of three eras, from Wordsworth to Woolf. Students
begin with the romantic revolution of the late 18th century, traverse the wide
19th-century span of Queen Victoria's reign, and cross into the modernist era following
the cataclysm of World War I. Within each era, students examine a literary manifesto, a
revolutionary event, an epic poem, a novel, and the aesthetics of the period. The course
emphasizes conversations across eras and striking moments of "making it new." Offered
